DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Source Site Biospecimen Donor Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A non-PHI ID assigned by the Tissue Source Site (TSS), the site of origination, which is used to identify the person who donated blood or tissue samples.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clinical site that collects and provides patient samples and clinical metadata for research use._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._One that contributes something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A clinical site that collects and provides patient samples and clinical metadata for research use.

Concepts.definition: A clinical site that collects and provides patient samples and clinical metadata for research use.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:One that contributes something.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/9/20 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval 7/6 email.  6/29/20 jk per discussion w/NGM, not an organ/tissue donor, rather a biospecimen donor; CUI revised.  6/5/20 jk created to clarify that TSS reflects the id assigned to the tissue donor/human and not the biospecimen.  This DEC replaces/supersedes DEC 7239771.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ValueDomain.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/9/20 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval 7/6 email.   6/29/20 jk created for new TSS ID CDE to reflect the id of person donating the tissue sample.

DataElement.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElement.changeDescription: 4/15/21 jk Added CM, HNSCC, and SAR FU, BSLN CSI. 10/30/20 jk added Normal Tissue CSI.  2020-9-8 ak Added CS/CSI. 8/27/20 jk added Procurement CSI.   7/9/20 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval 7/6 email.  6/29/20 jk revised for updated DEC, property semantics changed to reflect the donor of a biospecimen, not transplant donor. Superceded CDE 6770753. Add all new tumor baseline CSIs.  6/5/20 jk clarified DEC and Def to reflect ID associated with donor, not biospecimen.   4/25/20 jk Released per Mathangi. 4/10/20 jk Created for CPTAC Consent CRF. AQT added. AK 2020-5-26
